summary: ‘But you know what I told them? I said they didn’t stand a chance in hell. Because I am going to marry you,’ he promised her....
text: ‘But you know what I told them? I said they didn’t stand a chance in hell. Because I am going to marry you,’ he promised her. 'One day. I am going to marry you. I’ll be generous and let you pick when, even if it’s ten years from now. Or twenty. But one day, you are going to be my wife.’
source: Empire of Storms / Sarah J. Maas

reblog.comment: Empire of Storms / Sarah J. Maas

tags: A Court of Thorns and Roses
summary: Book #8 of 2019: A Court of Thorns and Roses by Sarah J. Maas (A Court of Thorns and Roses #1) I'm pretty underwhelmed by this...
caption:
Book #8 of 2019:

A Court of Thorns and Roses by Sarah J. Maas (A Court of Thorns and Roses #1)

I’m pretty underwhelmed by this retelling of Beauty and the Beast by way of Twilight, which somehow captures some of the worst impulses of both those narratives. There’s no real build-up to the heroine’s Stockholm Syndrome love for her theoretically beastly captor, who in this version of the story is actually an attractive faerie lord she immediately starts ogling. And I’m not saying that writers should completely throw out the trope of the teenage girl falling for a decades-older, boundary-ignoring inhuman love interest – Laini Taylor eventually pulls it off in her similarly-titled Daughter of Smoke & Bone series – but it’s a tricky act that I don’t feel author Sarah J. Maas manages here.

The plot is a bit uneven too, and the book has some rather explicit sex scenes for its otherwise Young Adult tone, especially given that some of those interactions feature dubious consent and at least one is just straight-up sexual assault. There’s also a recurring trend of slut-shaming – literally characters calling themselves and one another ‘slut’ and 'whore’ – that never once gets called out by the text or anyone in it. I’m uncomfortable enough as a man in my 30s to be reading this sort of thing, and I really worry about what sort of dynamics it’s modeling for younger readers.

★★☆☆☆

tags: For the love of a book
Anyone else do little excited jumps when they get a new book or is that just me?
summary: You know what the best part in a book is? When a character enters a library or a bookshop. You can feel the love the writer has...
body: You know what the best part in a book is? When a character enters a library or a bookshop. You can feel the love the writer has for books through the mind of their character. You can feel the excitement of the character as they delicately run their fingers over the glossy new, or slightly worn old books. You can sense the delight of them picking up a new book because that’s exactly what you feel when you get a new book.

reblog.comment: You know what the best part in a book is? When a character enters a library or a bookshop. You can feel the love the writer has for books through the mind of their character. summary:
Rowan: *runs into the throne room after being told there was an emergency*
Rowan: Fireheart, is everything alright?

body:
Rowan: *runs into the throne room after being told there was an emergency*

Rowan: Fireheart, is everything alright?

Aelin: *lounging on the throne* no, things are most certainly not alright. But you can fix it…

Rowan:…

Aelin: …by going and getting me some chocolate cake

summary:
Celaena: You know, I have actually been doing a lot better when it comes to killing people lately.
Chaol: *stares at her...
body:
Celaena: You know, I have actually been doing a lot better when it comes to killing people lately.

Chaol: *stares at her confused* But…Celaena I saw you dragging a body out of a room only 20 minutes ago.

Celaena: *crosses her arms* Okay, first of all, I said I was doing BETTER, not that I had stopped and secondly, is it not an improvement that I was disposing of the body rather than leaving it lying around..?

Chaol: ….

summary: Tower of Dawn || Sarah J. Maas || Throne of Glass #6 || 672 pages...
caption:
Tower of Dawn || Sarah J. Maas || Throne of Glass #6 || 672 pages
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Top 3 Genres: Fantasy / Young Adult / Romance

Synopsis: Chaol Westfall has always defined himself by his unwavering loyalty, his strength, and his position as the Captain of the Guard. But all of that has changed since the glass castle shattered, since his men were slaughtered, since the King of Adarlan spared him from a killing blow, but left his body broken.

His only shot at recovery lies with the legendary healers of the Torre Cesme in Antica—the stronghold of the southern continent’s mighty empire. And with war looming over Dorian and Aelin back home, their survival might lie with Chaol and Nesryn convincing its rulers to ally with them.

But what they discover in Antica will change them both—and be more vital to saving Erilea than they could have imagined.

Finished: January 11th, 2019.

Progress: 1 / 15. 6.66% complete.

My Rating: ★★★★★. [5/5]

My Review: [Under the read more - NOT SPOILER FREE]

Okay. Alright. Okay.

So this is a nearly 700 page book, and I finished it WAY before I thought I would. That would be because I was reading it during a work trip, and marathoned the final 400 pages in less than two days.

The fact that it hooked me in so completely that I actually brought it with me to sneak in pages during a BUSINESS CONFERENCE speaks worlds to me in how excellent and addicting it is.

FUCK how I have missed this series. Oh my GOD. I’m so glad I finally read this book. There’s only one left, which I am emotionally unprepared to start, but I remember when I heard about this book and went “I DIDN’T WANT ONE ABOUT JUST CHAOL GTFO”.

*stares into the camera*

BOY HOWDY how wrong I was.

I don’t even know how I can BEGIN to be articulate about the actual content of this book, because I’ve been finished with it for about four hours now and I still just go AHILUSDHLIUFHLIUDHHFHD whenever I think about it.

I haven’t gotten this excited over a book for a LONG TIME.

I just. The character development. The plot twists. The CULTURE. S. CULTURES. The relationships that developed. The complexities. The parallels. The DIVERSITY. The plethora of truly different female characters. The REPRESENTATION. The RESPECT.

HOLY SHIT HOW THAT ENDING GAVE ME FUCKING CHILLS.

And like. Both of the romantic relationships that came out of this. The FUCKING FEELS. Holy SHIT. I JUST. I CRIED and SHRIEKED and DANCED AROUND MY HOTEL ROOM and just holy fuck, okay.

I had to read the chapters slowly and one at a time in the beginning, to re-immerse myself in this world and absorb all the glorious details properly. But by the time I reached halfway… I couldn’t put it down.

I mean, fuck, I read 400 pages in two days. I haven’t done that in YEARS.

GOD it felt good.

And as unprepared as I am for this wonderful, wonderful series to be over, I am SO EXCITED to move right to the final book as soon as I can. I kind of want to give it time, so I can give this book the closure it deserves and so I can keep them divided in my head – treat it like I treat all other series, basically – but hoo boy. I am SO GLAD it’s already out and I’m not required to wait an entire year rofl.

Not reading a series as it comes out HAS ITS ADVANTAGES.

I’m quite sure this review is entirely useless, and is just a weirdly articulate expression of HALIUSHDLIUFHILGDF. I certainly do have thoughts about specific scenes and situations, and it wasn’t without its criticisms I am sure, but I just… can’t even begin to put all those thoughts into words. Nor do I really want to. AHSLIDUHFLIUDDing is enough.

My love knows no fucking bounds.

Not really a book I had asked for initially. But one I am now SO GLAD exists.

So this is a nearly 700 page book, and I finished it WAY before I thought I would. That would be because I was reading it during a work trip, and marathoned the final 400 pages in less than two days.

The fact that it hooked me in so completely that I actually brought it with me to sneak in pages during a BUSINESS CONFERENCE speaks worlds to me in how excellent and addicting it is.

FUCK how I have missed this series. Oh my GOD. I’m so glad I finally read this book. There’s only one left, which I am emotionally unprepared to start, but I remember when I heard about this book and went “I DIDN’T WANT ONE ABOUT JUST CHAOL GTFO”.

*stares into the camera*

BOY HOWDY how wrong I was.

I don’t even know how I can BEGIN to be articulate about the actual content of this book, because I’ve been finished with it for about four hours now and I still just go AHILUSDHLIUFHLIUDHHFHD whenever I think about it.

I haven’t gotten this excited over a book for a LONG TIME.

I just. The character development. The plot twists. The CULTURE. S. CULTURES. The relationships that developed. The complexities. The parallels. The DIVERSITY. The plethora of truly different female characters. The REPRESENTATION. The RESPECT.

HOLY SHIT HOW THAT ENDING GAVE ME FUCKING CHILLS.

And like. Both of the romantic relationships that came out of this. The FUCKING FEELS. Holy SHIT. I JUST. I CRIED and SHRIEKED and DANCED AROUND MY HOTEL ROOM and just holy fuck, okay.

I had to read the chapters slowly and one at a time in the beginning, to re-immerse myself in this world and absorb all the glorious details properly. But by the time I reached halfway… I couldn’t put it down.

I mean, fuck, I read 400 pages in two days. I haven’t done that in YEARS.

GOD it felt good.

And as unprepared as I am for this wonderful, wonderful series to be over, I am SO EXCITED to move right to the final book as soon as I can. I kind of want to give it time, so I can give this book the closure it deserves and so I can keep them divided in my head – treat it like I treat all other series, basically – but hoo boy. I am SO GLAD it’s already out and I’m not required to wait an entire year rofl.

Not reading a series as it comes out HAS ITS ADVANTAGES.

I’m quite sure this review is entirely useless, and is just a weirdly articulate expression of HALIUSHDLIUFHILGDF. I certainly do have thoughts about specific scenes and situations, and it wasn’t without its criticisms I am sure, but I just… can’t even begin to put all those thoughts into words. Nor do I really want to. AHSLIDUHFLIUDDing is enough.

My love knows no fucking bounds.

Not really a book I had asked for initially. But one I am now SO GLAD exists.
trail.content:
Tower of Dawn || Sarah J. Maas || Throne of Glass #6 || 672 pages
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Top 3 Genres: Fantasy / Young Adult / Romance

Synopsis: Chaol Westfall has always defined himself by his unwavering loyalty, his strength, and his position as the Captain of the Guard. But all of that has changed since the glass castle shattered, since his men were slaughtered, since the King of Adarlan spared him from a killing blow, but left his body broken.

His only shot at recovery lies with the legendary healers of the Torre Cesme in Antica—the stronghold of the southern continent’s mighty empire. And with war looming over Dorian and Aelin back home, their survival might lie with Chaol and Nesryn convincing its rulers to ally with them.

But what they discover in Antica will change them both—and be more vital to saving Erilea than they could have imagined.

Finished: January 11th, 2019.

Progress: 1 / 15. 6.66% complete.

My Rating: ★★★★★. [5/5]

My Review: [Under the read more - NOT SPOILER FREE]

Okay. Alright. Okay.

So this is a nearly 700 page book, and I finished it WAY before I thought I would. That would be because I was reading it during a work trip, and marathoned the final 400 pages in less than two days.

The fact that it hooked me in so completely that I actually brought it with me to sneak in pages during a BUSINESS CONFERENCE speaks worlds to me in how excellent and addicting it is.

FUCK how I have missed this series. Oh my GOD. I’m so glad I finally read this book. There’s only one left, which I am emotionally unprepared to start, but I remember when I heard about this book and went “I DIDN’T WANT ONE ABOUT JUST CHAOL GTFO”.

*stares into the camera*

BOY HOWDY how wrong I was.

I don’t even know how I can BEGIN to be articulate about the actual content of this book, because I’ve been finished with it for about four hours now and I still just go AHILUSDHLIUFHLIUDHHFHD whenever I think about it.

I haven’t gotten this excited over a book for a LONG TIME.

I just. The character development. The plot twists. The CULTURE. S. CULTURES. The relationships that developed. The complexities. The parallels. The DIVERSITY. The plethora of truly different female characters. The REPRESENTATION. The RESPECT.

HOLY SHIT HOW THAT ENDING GAVE ME FUCKING CHILLS.

And like. Both of the romantic relationships that came out of this. The FUCKING FEELS. Holy SHIT. I JUST. I CRIED and SHRIEKED and DANCED AROUND MY HOTEL ROOM and just holy fuck, okay.

I had to read the chapters slowly and one at a time in the beginning, to re-immerse myself in this world and absorb all the glorious details properly. But by the time I reached halfway… I couldn’t put it down.

I mean, fuck, I read 400 pages in two days. I haven’t done that in YEARS.

GOD it felt good.

And as unprepared as I am for this wonderful, wonderful series to be over, I am SO EXCITED to move right to the final book as soon as I can. I kind of want to give it time, so I can give this book the closure it deserves and so I can keep them divided in my head – treat it like I treat all other series, basically – but hoo boy. I am SO GLAD it’s already out and I’m not required to wait an entire year rofl.

Not reading a series as it comes out HAS ITS ADVANTAGES.

I’m quite sure this review is entirely useless, and is just a weirdly articulate expression of HALIUSHDLIUFHILGDF. I certainly do have thoughts about specific scenes and situations, and it wasn’t without its criticisms I am sure, but I just… can’t even begin to put all those thoughts into words. Nor do I really want to. AHSLIDUHFLIUDDing is enough.

My love knows no fucking bounds.

Not really a book I had asked for initially. But one I am now SO GLAD exists.

Thanks for checking by!

summary: A ver como digo esto sin parecer loca...
body:
A ver como digo esto sin parecer loca…

Alerta de spolier de Kindom of Ash

¿¡Pero que carajos con Kindom of Ash!?

¡¡¡¡La unión de las Chrochans, el sacrificó de las trece😫, Dorian y las llaves del Wyrd y su reunión con Chaol y Aelin😱, la maldita formación de la cerradura, la traición 😬y el cameo 😅 de Rhys y Feyre y su regresoooo!!!! 😲😱💓 Además de la confesión de Aedion a Lysandra y la noche de Lorcan y Elide 😍

Dios mio, dios mio, diooos mioooo.

No, aun no termino este infartante libro pero quería desahogarme porfavooor

Hasta aquí mi reporte 😂
